{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks for the drug that is not used for postpartum hemorrhage. Document [2] mentions that oxytocin is used for prevention and treatment of uterine atony, which is a common cause of postpartum hemorrhage. Document [3] mentions that prostaglandins are used for local hemostasis in severe postpartum hemorrhage. Prostaglandin F2 alpha is a type of prostaglandin, so it is likely used as well. Misoprostol is a type of prostaglandin and is used in the management of postpartum hemorrhage according to Document [14]. Dinoprostone is not mentioned in any of the documents as a treatment for postpartum hemorrhage.", "answer_choice": "B. Dinoprostone"}
